required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Utility of ERCP Guided Cholangiopancreatoscopy With the SpyGlass DS
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of the Clinical Utility of Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) Guided Cholangiopancreatoscopy With the SpyGlass DS.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective evaluation of the clinical utility of the new cholangioscopy platform SpyGlass DS. The aims of this study are to prospectively document the clinical utility and technical aspects of ERCP with cholangioscopy and/or pancreatoscopy in the diagnosis and management of pancreatic-biliary disorders.

detailed_description.textblock: Cholangioscopy allows for direct visualization of the bile and pancreatic duct. In 2006, the SpyGlass Direct Visualization System for per-oral cholangiopancreatoscopy was introduced and since then has been shown to provide incremental diagnostic and therapeutic benefits. The main limitations of the original SpyGlass platform are fiber optic visualization system, limited tip angulation, square cut Spy scope tip, and complex multi-component setup. A new generation cholangioscopy platform, SpyGlass DS is currently in clinical use. The new system addresses many of the shortcomings of old platform including digital optics, improved tip angulation, tapered tip and simplified set up. It is unclear at this time whether this technical improvement will translate into better outcomes. Therefore, the investigators want to study the clinical utility of SpyGlass DS by prospectively collecting data on the clinical outcomes of patients undergoing cholangioscopy with Spyglass DS as part of their routine medical care.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Procedure Technical Success
primary_outcome.description: The performance of the Spyglass DS during the endoscopy will be based on the ability to reach the target site, obtain samples, and to deliver therapeutic intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Set-up the Spyglass DS for the Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes to set up the Spyglass DS and related equipment for the procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement of Total Procedure Time Using the Spyglass DS
secondary_outcome.description: Time in minutes will be calculated for completing the procedure with the Spyglass DS.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement in Minutes for Spyglass DS Diagnostic Maneuvers
secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes to perform the diagnostic maneuvers with the SpyGlass DS measured in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measurement in Minutes for Spyglass DS Therapeutic Maneuvers
secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes to perform the therapeutic maneuvers with the SpyGlass DS in cases sampling was attempted measured in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Cholangioscopic Exams That Detected Ductal Stones
secondary_outcome.description: The abnormalities found during the procedure, such as ductal stones.

secondary_outcome.measure: Strictures Found During the Procedure Will be Measured
secondary_outcome.description: The abnormalities found during the procedure, such as strictures.
The mean number of attempts per procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Successful Removal of the Biliary or Pancreas Stones
secondary_outcome.description: The successful removal of the biliary or pancreas stones will be determined by the need for additional procedures.

arm_group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

intervention.description: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants who have been scheduled to undergo a cholangiopancreatoscopy as routine clinical care
Exclusion Criteria:
- failure to provide informed consent
- any contraindications to endoscopy

facility.name: Shands at the University of Florida

group.title: Cholangiopancreatoscopy
group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. Cholangiopancreatoscopy: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

baseline.population: 88 subjects signed consent but in 13 subjects a Spyglass examination was not done because of the lack of indication after performing standard cholangiography or pancreatography

group.title: Cholangiopancreatoscopy
group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. Cholangiopancreatoscopy: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Procedure Technical Success
outcome.description: The performance of the Spyglass DS during the endoscopy will be based on the ability to reach the target site, obtain samples, and to deliver therapeutic intervention.
outcome.population: Five of the subjects had both Cholangioscopy and Pancreatoscopy. The results of these procedures were recorded and analyzed separately

group.title: Cholangioscopy
group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. Cholangiopancreatoscopy: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

group.title: Pancreatoscopy
group.description: These are the subjects who had evaluation of their pancreas ducts during the Spyglass ERCP

measure.title: Number of Participants With Procedure Technical Success
measure.description: The performance of the Spyglass DS during the endoscopy will be based on the ability to reach the target site, obtain samples, and to deliver therapeutic intervention.
measure.population: Five of the subjects had both Cholangioscopy and Pancreatoscopy. The results of these procedures were recorded and analyzed separately

outcome.title: Time to Set-up the Spyglass DS for the Procedure
outcome.description: The time it takes to set up the Spyglass DS and related equipment for the procedure.
outcome.population: In 20 procedures, the Spyglass equipment set up was done after ERCP started and this time was recorded. The Investigators did not record the set up time for the other procedures.

group.title: Cholangiopancreatoscopy
group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. Cholangiopancreatoscopy: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

measure.title: Time to Set-up the Spyglass DS for the Procedure
measure.description: The time it takes to set up the Spyglass DS and related equipment for the procedure.
measure.population: In 20 procedures, the Spyglass equipment set up was done after ERCP started and this time was recorded. The Investigators did not record the set up time for the other procedures.

outcome.title: Measurement of Total Procedure Time Using the Spyglass DS
outcome.description: Time in minutes will be calculated for completing the procedure with the Spyglass DS.
outcome.population: 83 Spyglass procedures were conducted on the 75 participants

group.title: Cholangiopancreatoscopy
group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. measure.title: Measurement in Minutes for Spyglass DS Diagnostic Maneuvers
measure.description: The time it takes to perform the diagnostic maneuvers with the SpyGlass DS measured in minutes.
measure.population: 83 Spyglass procedures were performed on the 75 participants

outcome.title: Measurement in Minutes for Spyglass DS Therapeutic Maneuvers
outcome.description: The time it takes to perform the therapeutic maneuvers with the SpyGlass DS in cases sampling was attempted measured in minutes.
outcome.population: For the 75 participants in the study, 83 procedures were completed. Of the 83 procedures, sampling was attempted on 37 procedures in 27 participants.

group.description: A standard of care Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatoscopy (ERCP) will be performed using the Spyglass DS. The clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed. Cholangiopancreatoscopy: An ERCP with cholangioscopy/pancreatoscopy will be performed using the Spyglass DS. Clinical outcomes will be collected and analyzed.

measure.title: Measurement in Minutes for Spyglass DS Therapeutic Maneuvers
measure.description: The time it takes to perform the therapeutic maneuvers with the SpyGlass DS in cases sampling was attempted measured in minutes.
measure.population: For the 75 participants in the study, 83 procedures were completed. Of the 83 procedures, sampling was attempted on 37 procedures in 27 participants.

outcome.title: Number of Cholangioscopic Exams That Detected Ductal Stones
outcome.description: The abnormalities found during the procedure, such as ductal stones.
outcome.population: There were a total of 78 Cholangioscopic examinations in the 70 subjects in this study; 35 exam found stones. Where as in the Pancreatoscopy arm 5 participants were evaluated with only 3 exams being evaluable..

outcome.title: Spybite Sampling Attempts Per Procedure
outcome.description: The mean number of attempts per procedure
outcome.population: Of the 70 Cholangioscopy participants in the study only 44 participants had non-stone lithotripsy-related indications. Spyglass sampling was attempted in 36 procedures.

outcome.population: Spyglass-guided stone therapy was attempted in 26 patients with biliary stones

event.description: Serious AE with periampullary perforation caused by biliary sphincterotomy

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
